[b][color=white]Nearly every crypto coin rising again[/color][/b] 
Tensions ran high as almost every crypto currency decreased in value at the start of this week. Although noone was exactly sure what the reason for the mass decrease in value for the coins was, it seems to have stabalised itself yet again, as nearly every crypto currency is rising in value again. Bitcoin is up 15% while ethereum is rising with a decent 33,65% as of right now.[i][size=x-small][url=https://coinmarketcap.com/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[hr]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/iB7KuoT.png[/img]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035]Blizzard'[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Welcome to the 345 edition of the Hack Forums news. Today we have the member, Blizzard'. Would you like to give any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you. I'd like to shoutout my longtime HF buddies A ѕ ρ ι я є and Jaguar.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: You've been a member since 2010. A lot of things have changed over the years on this forum. Is there anything in specific that you miss?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: Yeah, I miss the old HF theme. I'd prefer the old theme any day but it just comes down to personal preference. Back those days we had HF reviewers group as well which I thought was really helpful for customers as it'd help them with their decisions in buying an eBook. Certainly there are few more things I miss, but these things I miss quite a lot!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Ebooks can be classified as a "meme" these days on Hack Forums. The HF Reviewers was a well respected group during its times. Were you ever a part of it? Also, how do you feel about the eBook scene now?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: I wasn't fortunate enough to be part of reviewers as I did not meet their requirements back then. They had a very strict recruitment process. Yeah they were very well respected and the member Skill managed the group very well as far as I remember. I've bought eBooks in the past that were recommended by official reviewers and went well. I feel the current ebook scenario has gone worse. Most of them are either filled with fake vouches which persuade customers into buying them. Even the 'Premium Sellers Section' is also filled with money making ebooks and I've seen people falling into those trap. Back then there wasn't any ebooks sold in 'Premium Sellers Section'. Now it looks like people try making money by selling methods that doesn't even work.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: It's pretty apparent you like to dabble in the marketplace. Has what you've learned from the HF marketplace helped you int he real world, let's say. For example, has the marketplace skills here helped you run and create a business?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: Yeah back then I was really active in the marketplace. I used to sell different products and made my income back then. HF will always be my first place where I was able to monetize. That experience has helped me establish and create a business online full time. Without HF, I don't think online monetization was even possible.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Pretty impressive. Congrats on that. Where do you see yourself on HF in the next few years? Do you ever plan on "retiring" like some members do, or do you still see yourself here in let's say the next 5 years.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: I'd still be here if HF is still running in the next 5 years. I don't even plan on retiring at all as HF will always be in my heart. Although I'm not as active on HF as I used to be I still enjoy visiting HF everyday, making friends and helping members with whatever knowledge I've learned during my stay since 2010.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: It's amazing to see how many people stick around after so many years. Are there any current projects you are working on that you'd like to share?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: Currently I'm just working on my website where I run my outsourcing service and my eBay businesses. Other than that, I don't have any project running currently as my business is going well. Hopefully as time passes by I might be able to invest in a project and release something on HF in future!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Sounds like fun. Is there anything you like to do outside of HF? Maybe you like to play an instrument, skydive. Anything fancy?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: I enjoy sports. I enjoy playing football and cricket. I play and follow club matches everyday. I also enjoy going to the gym as well to keep my body fit. Playing one of these sports keeps my mind fresh and decreases my stress level. It is one of the important things I do in my life and I enjoy them!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#f4909e][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: That's all the time we have for this interview this edition. Thank you for taking the time to do this interview with me. Are there any final words you would like to say?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=249035][color=#ffffff][b]Blizzard'[/b][/color][/url]: Nothing else. Just want to say thank you for interviewing me. It's been a pleasure talking to you!
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[b][color=white]Google AI Defeats Human Go Champion[/color][/b]
Google's DeepMind AlphaGo artificial intelligence has crushed the world's leading Go player Ke Jie. AlphaGo secured the triumph subsequent to winning the second diversion in a three-part match. DeepMind founder Demis Hassabis said Ke Jie had played "perfectly" and "pushed AlphaGo right to the limit."
Following the defeat, Ke Jie told reporters: "I'm a little bit sad, it's a bit of a regret because I think I played pretty well."
In Go, players take turns setting stones on a 19-by-19 matrix, contending to take control of the most territory. It is thought to be one of the world's most mind-boggling recreations and is a great deal more challenging for PCs than chess. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-40042581]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Asus ZenFone 3 Zoom, ZenFone AR coming to India[/color][/b]
Asus will launch the double-camera toting ZenFone 3 Zoom and the Tango-empowered - and also Daydream-prepared - ZenFone AR in India within two months. The company is all the while taking a shot at propelling a few new items - the ZenFone 3 Zoom and ZenFone AR - that it declared at CES in January earlier this year and is hoping to dispatch them with hardly a pause in between in the nation.
The ZenFone AR, then, is the world's first cell phone to bolster Google's mobile augmented reality stage called Tango as well its Daydream VR innovation. The smartphone is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 821 processor. [i][size=x-small][url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/technology/story/exclusive-asus-zenfone-3-zoom-zenfone-ar-coming-to-india-within-two-months/1/962409.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Apple is Working on a Dedicated AI Chip for the Upcoming iPhone[/color][/b]
US tech monster Apple is purportedly building up a committed artificial intelligence (AI) chip, called the Apple Neural Engine, that would control AI-related errands on cell phones. “The chip would be used to offload tasks that require sophisticated algorithms related to facial and speech recognition and augmented reality tasks that rely heavily on computer vision,” technology website theverge.com reported on Saturday.
The chip is additionally said to enhance battery life and the general execution of Apple gadgets. With the new chip, Apple tries to isolate the computationally concentrated assignments from the iPhone's processor and graphics chip. [i][size=x-small][url=http://tech.firstpost.com/news-analysis/apple-may-be-working-on-a-dedicated-ai-chip-for-the-upcoming-iphone-378619.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Sonic Mania Release Date Potentially Revealed By Steam[/color][/b] 
Grew up playing the Sonic games? On August 15 you will be able to get the chance to play the Sonic game you once knew and loved. Titled, "Sonic Mania" a 2D release, the game will be available for PC on Steam, Xbox One, PS4, and the Nintendo Switch. Taking a look at the gameplay, players will get to play "remixed" versions of the classic levels from the Sega era of Sonic. Another Sonic game which will be a 3D release called Sonic Forces and will feature more modern gameplay of Sonic. Sonic Forces. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-mania-release-date-potentially-revealed-by-s/1100-6450366/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Rapper Nas To Perform At EA's E3 Event, More Games Confirmed[/color][/b] 
Nas, DJ Green, and Dave East will be attending EA's panel at E3 2017 this year. In addition, EA plans on sharing more information on their latest games that will be released in the future. Some of these popular games include Star Wars Battlefront II and even Fifa 18. Of course Star Wars Battlefront II was already confirmed, and there are new sports games every year but do not fret! There are some releases that may bring some joy to some gaming games. For instance, a new Need for Speed game will be coming out. Going back to FIFA, Nintendo once again surprises us with a release for the Nintendo Switch. That surprise being FIFA. Yep, you heard that right. You'll be able to get that FIFA fix on the go or in home with the Switch! One last thing, the first 2,000 people to play the newest Battlefront game at the EA panel will get the chance to receive a limited-edition poster. While the first 500 people to check out FIFA 18, will get the chance to receive a free copy of FIFA 17 and Madden 17. Not a bad deal, right? [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/rapper-nas-to-perform-at-eas-e3-event-more-games-c/1100-6450354/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Monster Hunter XX Confirmed For Nintendo Switch[/color][/b] 
It is no secret that the Nintendo Switch keeps dishing out new surprises. One of those surprises being Minecraft and FIFA for the switch. If you are a fan of the Monster Hunter series, then the 20 installment of the game will be being released on the Switch! You can take a look at Capcom's website to take a further look into it, but do not stress yourself out doing so. No details other than it has been confirmed, and has been released to the public. Like said before, A lot of information has not been revealed yet, and the release date has not been announced. Another big thing being questioned is that, whether the game will be country specific (Japan) or not. Only time will tell! [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/monster-hunter-xx-confirmed-for-nintendo-switch/1100-6450359/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Judy Android Malware Infects Over 36.5 Million Google Play Store Users[/color][/b]
Security researchers have claimed to have discovered possibly the largest malware campaign on Google Play Store that has already infected around 36.5 million Android devices with malicious ad-click software. The security firm Checkpoint on Thursday published a blog post revealing more than 41 Android applications from a Korean company on Google Play Store that make money for its creators by creating fake advertisement clicks from the infected devices. All the malicious apps, developed by Korea-based Kiniwini and published under the moniker ENISTUDIO Corp, contained an adware program, dubbed Judy, that is being used to generate fraudulent clicks to generate revenue from advertisements. Once downloaded, the app silently registers user device to a remote command and control server, and in reply, it receives the actual malicious payload containing a JavaScript that starts the actual malicious process. The malicious apps are actual legitimate games, but in the background, they act as a bridge to connect the victim’s device to the adware server. [i][size=x-small][url=https://thehackernews.com/2017/05/android-adware-malware.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]7-Year-Old Samba Flaw Lets Hackers Access Thousands of Linux PCs Remotely[/color][/b]
A 7-year-old critical remote code execution vulnerability has been discovered in Samba networking software that could allow a remote attacker to take control of an affected Linux and Unix machines. Samba allows non-Windows operating systems, like GNU/Linux or Mac OS X, to share network shared folders, files, and printers with Windows operating system. The newly discovered remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2017-7494) affects all versions newer than Samba 3.5.0 that was released on March 1, 2010. According to the Shodan computer search engine, more than 485,000 Samba-enabled computers exposed port 445 on the Internet, and according to researchers at Rapid7, more than 104,000 internet-exposed endpoints appeared to be running vulnerable versions of Samba, out of which 92,000 are running unsupported versions of Samba. The flaw actually resided in the way Samba handled shared libraries. A remote attacker could use this Samba arbitrary module loading vulnerability (POC code) to upload a shared library to a writable share and then cause the server to load and execute malicious code. [i][size=x-small][url=https://thehackernews.com/2017/05/samba-rce-exploit.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]3 Nigerians Sentenced to 235 Years in Prison for Online Scamming[/color][/b]
A court in Mississippi has sentenced three Nigerian men to 235 years in prison for running online scams that duped people out of tens of millions of dollars. Oladimeji Seun Ayelotan, 30, was sentenced to 95 years in prison today, with associates Rasaq Aderoju Raheem, 31, getting 115 years and Femi Alexander Mewase, 45, getting 25 years. A jury found all three guilty of mail fraud, wire fraud, identity theft, credit card fraud and theft of government property. Ayelotan and Raheem were also found guilty of conspiracies to commit bank fraud and money laundering, which explains their longer sentences. The three were part of a 21-person case bought by US authorities against an accused gang based in Nigeria and the US. Twelve of them have already pleaded guilty. The gang would also use these clueless romantics to shift money from other rackets via Western Union and MoneyGram, or to resend goods bought with stolen credit and debit cards to countries where they could be sold for a profit. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/05/25/nigerians_sentenced_to_prison_online_scamming/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
